definition: Asarum/Wild ginger/also 細辛|细辛[xi4 xin1]
Asarum/Wild ginger/also 細辛|细辛[xi4 xin1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The many people is all not that clear to this, including the university numerous students.
sentences.chinese: 很多人對此都不太清楚，包括大學莘莘學子。

sentences.english: The lecture attracted many students of South China University of Technology.
sentences.chinese: 講座吸引了華南理工大學的莘莘學子，座無虛席。

definition: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
lit. when you drink water, think of its source (idiom); gratitude for blessings and their well-spring/Don't forget where your happiness come from./Be grateful for all your blessings!
our peasant friends (political term used in the early years of the Old Democratic Revolution, 1840-1919)/(Tw) (coll.) farmer
